definition: lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: The city still stands though much changed.
sentences.chinese: 那个城市虽然历经沧海桑田依然健在。

sentences.english: The vicissitudes, the wind and rain is rough, the great motherland experiences the tribulation.
sentences.chinese: 沧海桑田，风雨坎坷，伟大的祖国历尽磨难。

sentences.english: I can only see in this world, wandering in the passage.
sentences.chinese: 我只能在徘徊在此岸，看沧海桑田，世事变迁。

sentences.english: Accustomed to thinking in the mirror as the condensation, enjoy themselves.
sentences.chinese: 习惯了沉思凝结在镜中宛若沧海桑田，自己欣赏。

sentences.english: Overnight, the F is a sea change.
sentences.chinese: 一夕之间，己是沧海桑田。

sentences.english: These three years is the Chinese classical passage thirty years.
sentences.chinese: 这三十年也是中国古典舞沧海桑田的三十年。

sentences.english: I knew that I had undergone a sea change.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我身上发生了沧海桑田般的变化。

definition: lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
things have remained the same, but people have changed
the passage of the years/the flow of time
lit. the Big Dipper 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1] has turned and the stars have moved/time flies/also written 星移斗轉|星移斗转[xing1 yi2 Dou3 zhuan3]
lit. the Big Dipper 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1] has turned and the stars have moved/time flies/also written 斗轉星移|斗转星移[Dou3 zhuan3 xing1 yi2]
lit. having crossed the vast ocean (idiom)/fig. widely experienced in the vicissitudes of life
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
great changes/ups and downs/vicissitudes/abbr. of 滄海桑田|沧海桑田[cang1 hai3 sang1 tian2]
affairs of life/things of the world
